messages.title: RESPECT FOR PENSIONERS WITH PENSION BOOST
messages.content: The Conservative-led Government has delivered the biggest ever cash rise in the state pension says Meghan Gallacher.

messages.title: GROWING ECONOMY WITH THE CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: The last five years have seen the deficit cut by more than £52 billion, income tax cut for 25 million people and 1.75 million more people are in jobs than were in 2010.

messages.title: PETROL PRICE REDUCTION UNDER THE CONSERVATIVES
messages.content: Thanks to changes made by the Conservative-led government, fuel prices have been frozen, resulting in the longest sustained fall in over 20 years. Fuel duty is set to stay frozen throughout the next Parliament.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cutting the deficit, lowering income tax for 25 million people and increasing jobs.
Delivering the biggest ever cash rise in state pension.
Freezing fuel prices resulting in the longest sustained fall in over 20 years, with plans to keep fuel duty frozen.

mentions.candidate: Meghan Gallacher has been out and about speaking to local residents and learning about local issues.

issues.economy: The deficit has been cut by more than £52 billion, income tax cut for 25 million people, 1.75 million more people are in jobs.

leaflet.personalStatement: Meghan Gallacher is committed to North Lanarkshire and will work hard to bring new jobs and prosperity to the area.

contactInformation.address: Conservative Office, 570 Mosspark Boulevard, Glasgow, G52 1SD

images.caption: Meghan discusses local issues with Margaret Mitchell MSP.
Meghan has been out and about speaking to local residents and learning about local issues.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Meghan Gallacher has played a prominent role with the Better Together campaign team, notably working against politicians such as former First Minister Jack McConnell and Deputy First Minister, Nicola Sturgeon.
